data.title: RELEVANT DATA
questions: In this phase, establish what is.
What do we know?
What’s the current situation?
What parameters are most relevant in this situation?
What’s the data for these parameters? How’s it trending?
How accurate and reliable is our information? How do we know?
How quickly is the situation changing? Improving or worsening?
What’s potentially dangerous about this situation?
How is this event different from prior, similar incidents?
What are the forces or pressures helping us?
What is hurting, hindering or challenging us?
What resources and/or competencies can we deploy immediately?
What does our collective ‘gut’ tell us?

data.title: POSSIBLE FUTURES
questions: In this phase, brainstorm what could be, and what we want to be.
What else could the data be telling us? How might we be wrong?
How might we need to shift or expand our perspective?
What could happen? How might this situation evolve?
What’s the best-case scenario/outcome? Worst-case?
Where is this likely headed? How confident are we?
What could this be connected to? Related to? Dependent on?
How could we exploit the chaos inherent in the current state?
How might we look at this situation creatively?
What metaphor or analogy would best describe this?
What ideas, images or symbols does this bring to mind?
What’s a theme, pattern or ‘red thread’ running through this?
What insights or a-ha’s does anyone have?
How could we transform this into a potential opportunity?

data.title: STAKEHOLDER NEEDS
questions: In this phase, understand the people impact and messaging.
What’s the immediate impact on the people involved?
How are other groups/stakeholders viewing this situation?
What impact will this have on employees, customers and shareholders?
What are their specific needs, interests and concerns in this situation?
What do our stakeholders need and value most right now?
How do we deliver that to the extent possible?
What help do we need? Who could help us? With what?
What’s our communication strategy?
What message do we communicate? To whom? How?
How might we benefit from this? How could it help us?
How is this affecting us personally?
What’s our evaluation of the situation?

data.title: RESPONSE + NEXT STEPS
questions: In this phase, determine our response.
What’s the end game? What outcome do we want?
How do we make this happen?
What action(s) do we take immediately?
What do we need to communicate? To whom?
Who should be given authority/responsibility to manage it?
What are likely consequences of this situation?
What are the root causes? Why did this happen?
How do we prevent it from happening again?
Where is our greatest risk? What’s likely to go wrong?
What questions remain?
How do we stay informed as the situation evolves?
How soon should we meet again to follow-up?
